wikipedia_page.main: Brian Frederick Gilbert Johnson (born 11 September 1938 in Northampton, England) is a British scientist and emeritus professor of chemistry at the University of Cambridge. He was also Master of Fitzwilliam College, Cambridge from 1999 to 2005.

response: *  1938   – Brian F. G. Johnson, English chemist and academic

link_mentions.page: Jack Lewis, Baron Lewis of Newnham
response: Lewis's early career was dedicated to magnetic properties of metal complexes.  He achieved significant acclaim for contributions to metal carbonyl clusters. Together with his longtime collaborator Brian F. G. Johnson, his research group discovered many structurally unusual compounds.  Illustrative of their achievements is their synthesis of super tetrahedron [Os10C(CO)24]2−.
*Prof Brian F. G. Johnson, professor of inorganic chemistry from 1995 to 2005 at the University of Cambridge and Master from 1999 to 2005 of Fitzwilliam College, Cambridge
*Brian F. G. Johnson (born 1938), British scientist and professor of chemistry

response: * 1988 – Brian F. G. Johnson, David Anthony King, Stephen V. Ley
